history.content:
Help the EECS Department & Win Amazon Gift Cards!

Hi everyone!

Want to have your voice heard by EECS faculty, staff, and the Chairs?

HKN and other EECS student organizations have composed the 2017-18 EECS Undergraduate Survey so you can provide input and feedback to our very own EECS Department. This is a great opportunity for you to make a real impact in your classes, student life, and campus culture. Your thoughts will reach faculty and will be used to help improve the department and the community!

In addition, once you complete the survey, you can choose to enter a prize drawing to win one of fifteen (15) $10 Amazon gift cards!

Your response is completely anonymous. We encourage you to respond openly and honestly!

The survey is available here:

https://berkeley.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_dnyRdgjb0G1lJC5

2017 Undergraduate Student CRA Survey 

The Computing Research Association (CRA) is interested in career development among students in computing fields. They would like to hear about your experiences as a student, as well as your plans for the future. To that end, I encourage you to complete their brief survey, which will take no more than 20 minutes to complete.

Should you decide to complete the survey, you will be entered into a raffle for a $100 gift card to Amazon! Please fill out no later than December 15th to be eligible for the drawing. 

If you are interested in completing the survey, please click the link below, or copy and paste the URL into your internet browser:

https://cerp.co1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_3UH7q6TmdZ8YRPD

The survey is being conducted by the CRA’s Center for Evaluating the Research Pipeline (CERP). For more information on CERP, please visit their website: http://cra.org/cerp/.

 

*MIT SUMMER RESEARCH PROGRAM*
Amazing | Unforgettable | Enlightening | Life-Changing
APPLY @ msrp.mit.edu! DUE: Tuesday, January 16, 2018
For more information click here
 
*OPPORTUNITIES*
- Conduct research in state of the art facilities
- Receive supervision from MIT faculty, postdoctoral fellows, and
advanced graduate students
- Attend weekly academic and professional development seminars
- Participate in numerous community activities at MIT and in the
Boston/Cambridge area
- MIT provides a weekly stipend, roundtrip travel, and on-campus housing
 
*ELIGIBILITY*
- Currently enrolled college Sophomores, Juniors, and non-graduating
Seniors
- Attend a US home institution (or its territories)
- 3.5 GPA (Based on 4.0 scale)
- Have genuine interest in research and obtaining PhD
- African American, Latino, Native American, Native Hawaiian & Pacific
Islander, first-generation students, and students from low socio-economic
backgrounds are strongly encouraged to apply
 
*DATES: June 10 - August 11, 2018*
Watch this video: MIT Summer Research Program (MSRP General) 2017 Highlight Video
*Learn more about the experience of our MSRP 2017 Research Interns!*
*QUESTIONS?*
MSRP FAQs
msrp@mit.edu
Website

617-253-8453
 
*IDENTIFY YOUR RESEARCH AREA*
MIT faculty, departments and research groups
MIT Graduate Programs
participate in MSRP based on the admitted applicants’ areas of interest.

*ADDITIONAL OPPORTUNITIES*
@ MIT, MIT Summer Research Program and beyond via Pathways of Science database

Visit our Facebook page and our YouTube channel
 msrp@mit.edu
*Copyright © 2017 MIT OGE Diversity Initiatives, All rights reserved.*
The MIT Office of Graduate Education (OGE) strives to increase the
diversity of the graduate student body and to foster a nurturing, caring,
and inclusive campus environment. We send information to faculty,
administrators, and undergraduates who may benefit from learning about
MIT's diversity initiatives including MIT Summer Research Program, CONVERGE
Preview Weekend and more.
 
*Our mailing address is:*
MIT OGE Diversity Initiatives
77 Massachusetts Ave.
Bldg 35-332
Cambridge, MA 02139

MindSumo - New Computer Science Student Projects

Dear students,

Please review the latest computer science projects from MindSumo. MindSumo partners with employers to create projects that you can complete to get work experience, win prizes, and be hired for jobs and internships. Questions can be directed to isha@mindsumo.com 

ComEd - Help design a web dashboard or app for solar users - $11,600 in prizes 

Allstate - How would you improve the insurance claim process for customers? - $1,600 in prizes

Direct Links:
https://www.mindsumo.com/contests/solar-dashboard
https://www.mindsumo.com/contests/information-transfer-insurance

Thank you, 
Isha Punjabi | University Relations | MindSumo Inc. | www.mindsumo.com
